thread.title: Android O Developer Preview Released and Now Available!
thread.title_full: Android O Developer Preview Released and Now Available!

author: Kellex
title: Android O Developer Preview Released and Now Available!
text:
Android O Developer Preview Released and Now Available! 
Google just released the first Android O Developer Preview ! For real, though, it’s here! 
Android O will introduce new features by way of background limits on apps (think battery life boost), notification channels (more control over notifications), picture-in-picture, adaptive icons, autofill in apps, and more. Full details on what’s new can be found here . 
The new version of Android will run through four preview versions, with preview 2 hitting in mid-May, preview 3 in mid-June, preview 4 likely some time in August, and then the final release in Q3. It’s a similar schedule to last year’s Android N preview program. 
The first Android O Developer Preview is available for the Pixel, Pixel XL, Pixel C, Nexus 5X, Nexus 6P, and Nexus Player. 
You can download the Preview 1 images right here . Instructions on how to flash a factory image can be found here . Android O is now a part of the Android Beta at this time because it’s a hella-early developer build that probably isn’t all that stable. Post navigation 
Google releases Android O preview & Motorola still has me on Marshmallow. 
:sads: 
Looking forward to the O update on my Droid Turbo OG. Daniel Thomas 
Is the below sentence a typo? Should it read, “Android O is NOT…”? The way it’s written is confusing. 
“Android O is now a part of the Android Beta at this time because it’s a hella-early developer build that probably isn’t all that stable.” James 
I still have problems with notifications not arriving when Doze kicks in. Hopefully this helps. ynksbsbll2 
Possible typo: The last sentence says it’s now part of the beta, I believe it should say it’s NOT part of the beta Tyler Durden
